table.name: ss_status_history
table.description: This table is used to store the status of the shipment. The status is received via an external transmission. This table stores the event that triggered the status. The events can be: Arrived, Delivered, Delayed, Cargo Problems, Departed, Delivery Problem, Est_Arrival, etc.

columns.name: SHIPMENT_GID
columns.description: The shipment identifier for the tracking event.

columns.name: I_TRANSACTION_NO
columns.description: The transaction identifier for the shipment data of the tracking event.

columns.name: SERVPROV_GID
columns.description: The service provider associated with generating the tracking event.

columns.name: REPORTING_GLUSER
columns.description: The reporting application user if the tracking event was entered via the system's tracking event UI.

columns.name: REPORTING_METHOD
columns.description: The reporting method that links into the communication methods defined for OTM.

columns.name: SHIPMENT_STOP_NUM
columns.description: The shipment stop number for a stop based event.

columns.name: EVENT_LOCATION_GID
columns.description: The location identifier of an location based event. This will be null for non-location based events.

columns.name: IS_HIDDEN
columns.description: A Y/N indicator to display the status history.

columns.name: PARTITION_KEY
columns.description: The monthly range partition to manage purging status messages.

columns.name: DOMAIN_NAME
columns.description: Database domain where this data is stored.

columns.name: INSERT_USER
columns.description: The user ID of the data insert user.

columns.name: INSERT_DATE
columns.description: Date and time of data insert.

columns.name: UPDATE_USER
columns.description: The user ID of the data update user.

columns.name: UPDATE_DATE
columns.description: Date and time of the most recent data update.
